verses.verse: For the Chief Musician, for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. I said <WH559>, I will take heed <WH8104> to my ways <WH1870>, That I sin <WH2398> not with my tongue <WH3956>: I will keep <WH8104> my mouth <WH6310> with a bridle <WH4269>, While the wicked is before me <WH7563>.
I was dumb <WH481> with silence <WH1747>, I held my peace <WH2814>, even from good <WH2896>; And my sorrow <WH3511> was stirred <WH5916>.
My heart <WH3820> was hot <WH2552> within <WH7130> me <WH1901>; While I was musing the fire <WH784> burned <WH1197>: Then <WH227> spake <WH1696> I with my tongue <WH3956>:
Jehovah <WH3068>, make me to know <WH3045> mine end <WH7093>, And the measure <WH4060> of my days <WH3117>, what it is <WH3045>; Let me know how frail I am <WH2310>.

Behold <WH5414>, thou hast made my days <WH3117> as handbreadths <WH2947>; And my life-time <WH2465> is as nothing before thee <WH3605>: Surely every man <WH120> at his best estate <WH5324> is altogether <WH3605> vanity <WH1892>. <WH5542>[[Selah

Surely every man <WH376> walketh <WH1980> in a vain show <WH6754>; Surely they are disquieted <WH1993> in vain <WH1892>: He heapeth up <WH6651> riches <WH3045>, and knoweth not who shall gather them <WH622>.
And now <WH136>, Lord, what wait <WH6960> I for <WH8431>? My hope is in thee.
Deliver <WH5337> me from all my transgressions <WH6588>: Make <WH7760> me not the reproach <WH2781> of the foolish <WH5036>.
I was dumb <WH481>, I opened <WH6605> not my mouth <WH6310>; Because thou didst it <WH6213>.
Remove <WH5493> thy stroke <WH5061> away <WH5493> from me <WH3615>: I am consumed by the blow <WH8409> of thy hand <WH3027>.

When thou with rebukes <WH8433> dost correct <WH3256> man <WH376> for iniquity <WH5771>, Thou makest his beauty <WH2530> to consume away <WH4529> like a moth <WH6211>: Surely every man <WH120> is vanity <WH1892>. Selah <WH5542>

Hear <WH8085> my prayer <WH8605>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, and give ear <WH238> unto my cry <WH7775>; Hold not thy peace <WH2790> at my tears <WH1832>: For I am a stranger <WH1616> with thee <WH8453>, A sojourner, as all my fathers were <WH1>.
Oh spare <WH8159> me <WH1082>, that I may recover strength, Before I go hence <WH3212>, and be no more.
